intro: Monogynella blancheana, commonly known as Blanche's monogynella, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in dense undergrowth. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
